results.description:
The plan is to summit one of the more remote NH 4K peaks, Owl's Head Mtn (4,025 feet), covering approximately 18 miles with 2,850 feet of elevation gain.  I say approximately because using the Black Pond and Brutus bushwhacks reduces the mileage from the book estimates by how much is unclear.  Book time is estimated at 12 hours, but with a good group pace and using the bushwhacks I expect to come in under book time.   This trip is considered ADVANCED due to total mileage and elapsed time over 10 hours.  This trip is intended for conditioned hikers with recent experience with both winter 4Ks and trips of this length.

Trip Details:

We will start and finish at the Lincoln Woods Visitor Center (on NH Route 112/Kancamagus Hwy). We will take the Lincoln Woods Trail 2.6 mi to the Black Pond Trail.  After 0.8 mi to Black Pond, we will locate the Black Pond Bushwhack using compass and looking for recent traffic.   The bushwhack runs mostly North for one mile landing on the Lincoln Brook Trail.  We follow Lincoln Brook (& the trail) nearly 3 mi eventually looking for signs of the Brutus Bushwhack on the right (East) side of the brook.  Brutus brings us to the ridge East of the old summit, where we pick up Owl's Head Path to the true summit.


I did my research using the White Mountain Guide and recent reports on TrailsNH.com.  Mountain weather is subject to rapid changes and extreme conditions. Dangerous weather conditions will cancel - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants a day or two ahead of time. We will assess travel and weather conditions during the hike and make changes to our planned trip as necessary.

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

Guest Policy:  Guests are not permitted for this trip; all hikers must register with Meetup and join NEPB.

Pet Policy:  Please do not bring dogs on this trip.

Current Weather Conditions:

http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.1075&lon=-71.5818#.Vq01WlJwtiY

Please read the entire event description before you RSVP, and answer all questions. It is important, not only for your safety, but that of the entire group.

Gear List: Winter Packing List

All hikers who sign up must have alpine-caliber snowshoes and some type of traction (spikes or crampons).  Final gear choice will be made as a group upon departure, but you must bring the gear with you to the trail head.

Any carpooling is each person’s responsibility to arrange. I suggest the Park & Ride at Salem, NH or LL Bean Parking lot in Concord.

I can be reached at [masked] if you have questions or are running late.  Please show courtesy with the RSVP system if your plans change, and if you are unable to update the RSVP text or call my cell #.  We will not wait for anyone signed up that I cannot contact.


As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear and agree to know and follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com.

I have a 2016 NH Hike Safe Card and I recommend that you purchase one too.

results.description:
4th Annual Massachusetts Urban Farming Conference 

The 4th Annual Massachusetts Urban Farming Conference
is designed to advance urban farming issues ranging from farming techniques and business models to climate change adaptation and food security. Network with Massachusetts' diverse, multi-sector stakeholders in this dynamic event that looks at current issues, emerging practices and programs, and markets that can contribute to Massachusetts' urban farming sector. 

The annual Massachusetts Urban Farming Conference (UFC), in partnership with the Massachusetts Department of Agriculture, is designed to advance the opportunities and address the barriers involved in cultivating a resilient and thriving Urban Farming sector. The UFC is a multi-sector stakeholder forum designed to share information regarding what is currently happening in Massachusetts. The UFC fosters solutions, sustainable networks and business relationships.

The conference brings together participants representing all aspects of Urban Farming including, but not limited to, farmers (including roof top, chicken, bees, etc.), land trust managers, policy makers, commercial buyers, foundations, investors and all others.

https://urbanfarminginstitute.wordpress.com/2nd-annual-massachusetts-farming-conference/
For more information, contact Rose Arruda at MDAR; [masked]

results.description:
The meetup page isn't able to post two dates, but yes, it is a two day event, 9-3 on Saturday (includes a pizza lunch) and 9-1 on Sunday!  It is $165 for the weekend and that includes materials!  To register click on www.cherylcohenmosaics.com, and also take a look at my work.  Please take a look at my Facebook page too, "Cheryl Cohen Mosaics" to see my fabulous student's work!

You will start with plate smashing. Yes, break plates with a hammer which is as much fun as it sounds! Learn to position the shards (tesserae) and pick grout colors to enhance your design on a picture frame or tile. Next you will learn to use a variety of materials (rocks, shells, jewelry, mirrors, beads, plate shards, etc.) to embellish a picture frame, coaster or light switch cover. I will help you take a random group of objects and make a cohesive one-of-a-kind work of art. Learn to use mosaic tools (wheeled cutters and nippers) to cut and shape plate pieces and then learn to grout and finish your work. It’s fun, freeing and rewarding! and/or (as a second option)


Do you have family items, costume jewelry, photographs, chipped plates, shell/rock/coin collections, buttons, etc. handed down from loved ones that you cherish, sitting in a drawer? Use them to make wall art that you can enjoy daily. We will add complementary materials (rocks, shells, jewelry, mirrors, beads, plates, etc.) from my studio to your supplies to make that special piece. Create art that will make you smile and remember that special person.

For experienced students who come to the studio regularly, this is a great time to plan and work on larger projects!

Open to the public as always!

Each spring, right before Easter, the Foxboro Jaycees fill over 2500 (yes, two thousand and five hundred!) plastic eggs with candy and scatter them across Foxboro Common.

(It’s not really a “hunt” because the thousands of eggs are everywhere so everyone gets a good bounty of goodies!)

On that morning, approximately 300 children race to collect as many eggs as they can. We have three hunts separated by three age groups (1-3 years), (4-5 years), and (6-7-8 years)

In recent years we have phased out the "9 and 10" age group; this event is more for little kids. The kids then have a meet and greet with the Easter bunny and get their picture taken. Feel free to bring your own camera if you like!

THE ENTIRE EVENT INCLUDING THE PICTURES IS FREE!

2016 Date - Saturday, March 12 at 9:30AM (rain date if necessary is  the following day: March 13)

results.description:
To kick off the year of 2016, all Big Data Boston group members are invited to a virtual Hadoop conference. It's a great learning opportunity for anyone who are interested in learning big data and Hadoop. Hadoop With The Best is an one-day conference with 10 50-mins presentations from leading Hadoop scientists and engineers. On top of that, you can book an exclusive 1:1 session (10-15mins) with one of the speakers. 

You must complete the following steps to attend: 

1) Go to hadoop.withthebest.com
2) Register with the code hd16bg to get the 50% off exclusive discount ($12.50)
3) An invitation to the platform will be sent to you shortly after your registration, where the conference will be taking place. 

All registrants will be able to access the archives for 2 months after the conference. 

The conference will kick off with our keynote speaker, Andrew Psaltis, Data Engineer at Shutterstock. Data experts Ron Bodkin (president at Big Data Analytics) and Mark Mims (Pincipal Engineer at SVDS) along with other 8 speakers will also be joining us. 

Topics include: 


- Streaming meets Hadoop (Keynote)
- Fast data steaming with Hadoop
- Identify user activity from streams of raw events
- Hadoop and big data design patterns

Note: The discount code is only valid for the first 30 members who register on hadoop.withthebest.com.

SILENT Meditation Retreat

SATURDAY | MARCH 12th 


10:00am - 4:00pm

Experience the freedom of inner stillness through meditation on this full-day silent retreat. By observing silence we have the opportunity to turn our attention inwards, focus on our meditation practice and gain deeper insight and relaxation.

Peace of mind is priceless. Whenever it arises we’re happy, our body becomes comfortable and we have a good influence on those around us.  In this silent retreat, we will focus on improving our meditation skills and deepen our experience of maintaining an open and accepting heart towards others in our life. Come and enjoy the silence! No previous meditation experience necessary.

results.description:
Since its founding in 1994, Science Club for Girls (SCFG) has provided the very best in girls-specific programming by connecting girls in K-12 grades, especially those from underrepresented groups, with female mentor-scientists through free science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) programs in a fun, nurturing, interactive environment. Their club-based model fosters both scientific thinking and sisterhood for their youngest participants. Their teen leadership programs give girls the opportunity to be role models, teach young children science, learn life skills, conduct science research in applied settings, and explore careers in science and technology.

As of the[masked] program year, approximately 1,000 girls participate in SCFG programs in 17+ sites across four communities in eastern Massachusetts (Boston, Cambridge, Lawrence, and Newton). Sites are hosted by schools, community centers, the campuses of colleges and universities, and inside the corporate offices of partner companies in STEM fields.

Volunteers will be packing, organizing, and preparing materials for upcoming SCFG programs!

**Side note, although this is the Science Club For GIRLS, everyone is invited and encouraged to volunteer!

Please visit the SCFG website for additional information: 
http://www.scienceclubforgirls.org/
results.name: Science Club For Girls

results.description:
Leave the winter behind and enter the spring with positive intentions, powerful motivation, and high energy. 


Two Insight facilitators, Janet Parker and Mike Connor, will lead us in a inspiring day, designed to re-motivate, re-inspire and re-commit each of us to our individual dreams. Janet and Mike have over 50 years combined experience, teaching Insight Seminars around the USA and the world.
  We'll look at the essential change/transition that that we each want to experience this year.  We'll forgive and accept the past, appreciate the present, and then open a powerful space within ourselves to create that future for ourselves. 

Using group discussion, Coaching, partner work, and closed eye processes,  Janet and Mike will show you the 7 Keys to successful transitions and new beginnings.

Take a day out to refocus on creating a year that you will remember.
results.name: Insight: New Beginnings - Embrace the Present to Create the Future (Open to all)

results.description:
MASON BEES, or orchard bees, are prodigious pollinators. Unlike honey bees, mason bees are solitary (and native to the Americas) and, as such, all females are fertile and produce eggs which they lay in small deep holes packed with food (a pollen and nectar mix), and seal with mud.  And they're really cute & gentle.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

WORKSHOP & CLASS:  Learn about our native mason bees and how to provide them an attractive nesting house. The workshop ends with a mason bee house construction project after which every participant will leave with a mason bee house ready for the bees' arrival -- any day now! Provide them a home and they will move in.

They'll be here soon but they're only active for a few weeks; they showed up in Boston by April 16 last year.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The entire two-part workshop will be taught twice, once from 10-12 and again from 12-2. For more information, please call Bill at[masked]-7378.

Attendees are encouraged to bring an empty can measuring anywhere from 2 - 3.5 inches in diameter and 4-5 inches tall. You'll see why..... ;-)

Registration is required for this paid (but affordable) event. Visit http://masonbees.bpt.me/ or call Bill at[masked]-7378.
results.name: The Mighty Mason Bee

Community members of all ages are invited to the Community Growing Center at 22 Vinal Avenue between 10am and 2pm to watch and learn for free as sap from local sugar maple trees is boiled down into pure maple syrup over a warm fire. Attendees can expect syrup-tasting, kids’ activities, demonstrations, and more! Pancakes, hot drinks, and Maple Syrup Project T-shirts and posters will be on sale! Please join us at this unique outdoor festival as we celebrate the dawn of spring and our local urban resources. Use #mmmsyrup to follow the maple syrup news or to post about the event!

For more information about The Maple Syrup Boil Down 2016, the education series, or syrup production contact Sarah Lindsay ~ [masked] ~ or call[masked]-9988.

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

results.description:
(a set of 6 Saturday classes)


Always wanted to learn how they really fought in the middle ages? Forget any ideas about crude battering on armour; the successful warrior strikes to the gaps and the openings of his or her opponent's attacks, and supplements this with disarms, throws, and other techniques which secure the advantage over larger or stronger attackers.

Around the year 1400, Fiore dei Liberi trained medieval knights and squires, and authored multiple books of medieval combat, some of which have survived to the present day. His method, L'Arte d'Armizare (the Art of Bearing Arms), shows an integrated and cross-referenced system of sword, dagger, grappling, spear & lance, pollaxe and other weapons on foot and on horseback, with and without armour, and easily dispels any illusions that medieval combat was about unskilled strength.

Our beginners' course is six linked classes that give the basic techniques and vocabulary of L'Arte, and enables men and women to begin regular unarmoured training and learning.  No prior training needed; all class equipment is provided.

So, come join the scholars and combatants of our company!

(The price shown is for the set of all six classes (Mar 5, 12, 19, Apr 2, 9 and 16.  There is no class on the weekend of Mar 26) and membership and registration.  Classes are not offered separately.  We'll send an email with some class materials before the first session.)

results.description:
Hi all, 

A friend of mine from back home recently has been diagnosed with a condition known as cardiomyopathy, and has been given a Left Ventricle Assist Device or LVAD to aid her heart function until she receives a heart transplant. 

This Halloween, we will be hosting a costume-themed charity workout to show our support for Olivia, and raise money for her various medical and living expenses. To fully understand why we are hosting this charity, you must first understand her story:

From her sister, Sofia Hart:

"Olivia always thrived to do the best she could. Being gifted with horse back riding as our hobby (or life passion) growing up, she was incredibly fearless and passionate with everything in her. She was also happy to be a Vineyarder during her years playing Hockey and Soccer, representing the place she loved most, home. Her determination was unstoppable on and off horse back, the field, and the ice. These characteristics followed her through her life growing into adulthood. 

As a recent University of Vermont graduate, she did just the same in her studies. When she felt defeated, she would do everything in her power to figure out what went wrong, and how she could fix her mistakes. While at her graduation, tears of joy were brought to my eyes as she smiled receiving her achievements and laughed and hugged with friends. Not only was she proud of herself, but she was even more proud of the people who surrounded her and their accomplishments too.

These qualities and characteristics went even further into the workplace. As a former employee of the Homeport Resturant, she used the skills and experience she learned there and carried it to the Seafood Shanty. Each and every job she has held has meant so much to her. Good days and bad days, she always would talk so highly of her job, especially for how dedicated she was to each establishment. 

Through hardwork, fearlessness, dedication and most importantly, love, Olivia has gained a rather admirable reputation growing up on Martha's Vineyard for 22 years, and at UVM during her college years. 

These amazing qualities and characteristics have not diminished one bit during these tough times. Her spirit is incredibly high, and she shocks us on a daily basis how positive her attitude is. I can not imagine being in her place, and handling the news she gets on a daily basis. Although she has received bad news many times, her positive outlook has not changed. Olivia is determined as ever, looking toward the brightest future."

Here is more on Olivias condition, with a post from her Facebook page:

"So here it is. On the 9th I was transported to Massachusetts General Hospital and diagnosed with a condition known as cardiomyopathy which is a disease of the heart muscle. There is damage to both the right and left portions but the majority of the damage is in the left ventricle. It wasn't until I had a cardiac MRI that the doctors realized my condition was most likely irreversible. The doctors believe it either began years ago when I most likely contracted a viral infection that attacked my heart or may have been something I was born with... the overall cause is unknown. My age enabled me to live and thrive with the condition until a couple of months ago. Currently, I am in the process of being placed on the heart transplant list, which I will hopefully be accepted to by the end of the week, and will receive a new heart by the start of the new year. For now that is about all that we know."

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

results.description:
Meeting at edge of parking lot near the machine used to buy parking passes. Please arrive 15 minutes early. We start hiking on time; plan your travel accordingly.

The Hike:

We will follow the yellow and blue trails (from the trail map) forming a giant figure eight. But I frequently deviant from the plan :-) Expect to hike about 2-3 miles at a moderate pace over various terrain - mostly gentle hills. At this time of the year, be prepared for icy paths or/and muddy trails. See below for what to wear.

online trail map (pdf)  http://www.thetrustees.org/assets/documents/places-to-visit/trailmaps/Rocky-Woods-Fork-Factory-Brook-Trail-Map.pdf

Even more details about the park: http://www.thetrustees.org/places-to-visit/greater-boston/rocky-woods.html

After Hike, Food and Drinks:

After the hike, we will gather for food and drinks.

Rock N Roll Rib Joint offers smoked meats cooked "low and slow", delectable sides and great drink selections!

* Rock N Roll Rib Joint, 14A North Meadows Road, Medfield, MA

* http://www.rocknrollribjoint.com/


RSVP Responsibility!

Only RSVP if you can go and update your RSVP (don't wait until the day of the event) if you can't make it.

I am only a volunteer. I will be waiting at the trail starting point, and I will be expecting you. I look forward to meeting you.

* No pets allowed on hike.

* Members only. No guests permitted.

* Members must have a valid photo.

Dress:

* Hiking shoes. Because of the wet trail conditions at this time of the year, good athletic shoes won't do.

* If there are icy paths, microspikes (or something similar) are REQUIRED.

* Dress appropriately for the weather conditions.

* Dress in layers as needed.

* Non-cotton clothing works best.  

* Bring water, snacks and any personal medicines and gear you may need as well.

FOUL WEATHER CANCELS.

You assume all risk associated with this activity.

Liability Waiver: As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at <a>www.hikesafe.com;</a> the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Directions to Hike:

Parking Fee: $5 (at machine using credit card) for non-members of TToR (The Trustees of Reservations)

The official address is:

* 64 Rocky Woods Reservation Entrance, Medfield, MA 02052

Better for GPS (the entrance to the park):

* 35 Hartford St, Medfield, MA 02052

From I-95/Rt. 128 (Exit 16B): Rt. 109 West for 5.7 mi. Turn right onto Hartford St. and follow for 0.6 mi. to entrance and parking (100 cars) on left.

From Intersection of Rts. 27 and 109 (Medfield): Take Rt. 109 East and bear left onto Hartford St. Continue as above.
results.name: 👣 Rocky Woods Hike then BBQ

results.description:
OM (Orgasmic Meditation) is a simple way for people to practice their orgasm. It's like....yoga for your orgasm. And, the more you practice, the more you feel.


The Intro To OM Class is the perfect way to learn OneTaste's signature practice of OM, a simple practice with revolutionary results. Learn how to feel more, connect more deeply to your partner, and enliven your sex in just fifteen minutes a day.

The course will include:
- The philosophy behind OM
- Introduction of a new definition of Orgasm: the difference between Climax and Orgasm
- Exploration of OneTaste principles: Attention, Simplicity & Desire and how they relate to your OM practice
- The benefits of an OM practice
- Live demonstration of OM
- Basic stroking technique
- A chance to have your first OM with the guidance of trained OneTaste coaches (the "OM Lab")


Intro To OM is a great starting point for both men and women, single or coupled, and will give you the right foundation to begin building your OM practice and cultivating your Orgasm.

Open to singles and couples ages 18+ (adults of all genders)
Returning OMers are also welcome - come brush up on your skills!
Pre-requisite: Watch the How to OM Video (available at http://onetaste.us/welcome/)

Intro To OM Course Details:
- Price: $197/person (discounts available is you sign up at a TurnON!)
- 6 hours total includes course, lunch break, and optional OM Lab after the course.


After the class, you can:
- Start your OM practice: we recommend at least three times a week!
- Attend OM Circles (where the community comes together for guided practice) anywhere in the world!
- Join OM Practice Club: a weekly session with local OM coaches to deepen your understanding of OM and increase your facility with the practice. 

Registration:
You must register at the eventbrite site - RSVPing on the Meetup page does not hold you a spot, and space is limited.

SO excited to welcome new OMers to the community!

To register for the course, please go to: </a><a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/boston-intro-to-om-orgasmic-meditation-march-2016-tickets-21071725097">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/boston-intro-to-om-orgasmic-meditation-march-2016-tickets-21071725097

results.description:
Join us for the March 2016 Meetup!

ATC THEMES:


1. Ephemera (What is ephemera? Here's a definition from the Ephemera Society of America; if the link still doesn't work, just Google it). If you received a goodie bag at December 2015 Meetup, you've got plenty of ephemera. If not, you'll easily find some!


2. Artist's Choice (anything goes)


DEMO/ACTIVITY:  TBD.


WHAT OTHER SUPPLIES SHOULD I BRING? There's a suggested list in "All About the NE ATC+ Meetup" (also at the top of the Message Board). But even if you show up empty-handed, that's fine--we have loaner tools.

POTLUCK LUNCH: You're invited, but certainly not required, to bring food or drink for our potluck lunch, or to just bring your own lunch. No need to sign up; bring whatever you like. Please remember that you must take, give away, or throw away any food you bring; we can't leave ANYTHING behind.

FREE STUFF/SALE ITEMS: You're welcome to bring items to give away or sell to other Meetup members onsite. But anything that doesn't get taken or sold needs to go home with you. 

COST: $10, regardless of when you arrive or depart; it covers our costs for the day. Sorry, no partial payments or IOUs. Cash is preferred; small bills are greatly appreciated. You can break large bills in businesses on Route 135 near the church. If payment is a hardship, please let the organizer know--we can work it out.

RSVPs: Please RSVP "yes" to attend; that way, we'll have an approximate headcount, and you'll receive all notifications about the Meetup! If your plans change, and you will be unable to attend, please change your RSVP to "no" no later than 24 hours before the start of the Meetup, so we'll know not to expect you. Anyone who cancels within 24 hours, regardless of the reason, will need to pay the fee anyway to help cover our costs for the day. 

LAST-MINUTE UPDATES: Please check your email in box and the website before leaving for the Meetup. That way, in the unlikely event that we need to cancel due to bad weather or any other reason, you'll be sure to get the news.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Discover the wonders that Darwin saw on his journey to Patagonia in Southern Chile

http://ciclismoclassico.com/trips/patagonia-wildlife-adventure/

Join renowned South American photographer and nature documentary filmmaker Ossian Lindholm in this idyllic blend of nature, culture and wildlife and discover the wonders that captivated Darwin on his Patagonian sojourn at the bottom of the earth. Here lies a dazzling world of calving glaciers, rushing waterfalls, and towering peaks rising from blue green seas, and remote, mist-shrouded islands. By boat, foot, and vehicle, we explore the hidden corners of Chiloe Island, home to a fiercely independent, sea-faring people. The island boasts a unique flavor from the mainland– from its renowned food to its stilted wooden architecture. Wet and windswept, with lush hills and an early morning fog that cloaks, perhaps it is no wonder that the people here have a distinctive spiritual mythology of witchcraft, ghost ships, and forest gnomes. Discover wild and remote national parks, home to Humboldt and Magellan penguins, endangered pudu, and sea otter. Visit villages, the market, and traditional wooden churches and homes.

You will be a part of an important conservation effort by the Audubon Society and The Nature Conservancy, who along with local partners, are involved in initiatives to spread awareness about the importance of coastal wetland habitats to migratory shorebirds and ensure that Hudsonian godwits and Whimbrels have a safe and sustainable wintering place for years to come
results.name: Pumas, Penguins in Patagonia! Wildlife & Culture Adventure in Chile

results.description:
THE DATE: Saturday March 12, 2016 from 12:00 - 1:30pm

THE RESTAURANT: Santa Banta at 458 Moody St in Waltham

THE BOOK: The Shadow of the Crescent Moon by Fatima Bhutto

20+ copies in the Minuteman Library System.

Fatima Bhutto's stunning debut novel The Shadow of the Crescent Moon begins and ends one rain swept Friday morning in Mir Ali, a small town in Pakistan's Tribal Areas close to the Afghan border.
Three brothers meet for breakfast. Soon after, the eldest, recently returned from America, hails a taxi to the local mosque. The second, a doctor, goes to check in at his hospital. His troubled wife does not join the family that morning. No one knows where Mina goes these days. And the youngest, the idealist, leaves for town on a motorbike. Seated behind him is a beautiful, fragile girl whose life and thoughts are overwhelmed by the war that has enveloped the place of her birth.
Three hours later their day will end in devastating circumstances.
The Shadow of the Crescent Moon chronicles the lives of five young people trying to live and love in a world on fire. Individuals are pushed to make terrible choices. And, as the events of this single morning unfold, one woman is at the center of it all.
'A first novel of uncommon poise and acuity, The Shadow of the Crescent Moon is set in an old and protracted war for land and dignity. But its swift and suspenseful narrative describes a fiercely contemporary battle in the human heart: between the seductive fantasy of personal freedom and the tenacious claims of family, community and history.' Pankaj Mishra
Fatima Bhutto was born in Kabul, grew up in Damascus, and lives in Karachi. This is her first novel.

results.name: The Shadow of the Crescent Moon @ Santa Banta in Waltham

New England Backgammon Club Newsletter -- March 2016

Date: 

March 7, 2016 at 9:28:59 PM EST

100% Return in March!Due to high turnout and people being good about paying their food tabs, the club has taken in a bunch of "extra" money this year. All money not earmarked for expenses must be returned to the players. So we'll be having a 100% return tournament in March (and stay tuned for others...) I expect a high turnout, so come, have a nice discounted meal ($5 off, courtesy of the NEBC), and vie for your share of an outsized prize pool!

Ahmet Leaps over CompetitionAhmet Bolat has only a few tournaments under his belt, but he had no problem winning 5 matches in a row to take home the gold in February. The silver medal went to Anne Bidner. Semi-finalists were new member Oliver Outerbridge and Daniel "Frequent Casher" Bluestone. The consolation finals was won by Alex Zamanian who eked out a win over second place David Kornwitz.

We had a good turnout in February -- 29 players! The most since September's 30. It's nice to see so many new players, I suspect we might be hitting new highs before the season is out. 
March TournamentOur next tournament is Saturday, March 12th at 12:00. Entry fees are $60 for Expert and $30 for Intermediate/Novice. As always, entering for Intermediate/Novice means you get half the normal prize money should you cash in the tournament.

Please show up before noon to register. If you're going to be a little late, you can call or text my mobile,[masked], to reserve a spot. If for some reason I don't pick up, leave a message. I'll be sure to check my messages before we begin the draw.

Points RaceTom O'Riordan generously sat one out in February to let everyone catch up. (It would be way too easy for him otherwise.) After the May tournament (3 left to go!) the top 7 players play in a playoff tournament for the title of NEBC Champion! and prize money provided by the club. For full standings, see our website: www.nebackgammon.org .

results.description:
Do you love eating eggs? Have you ever struggled with cooking them to a perfect texture consistently? This class will cover techniques to help you perfect a soft fluffy French omelette, creamy Thai omelette, a perfect runny yolk in your poached eggs, a crunchy buttery white with a centered yolk in your fried eggs, hard boiled eggs that don't get all mangled when you peel them, a flipped frittatta that isn't too brown and doesn't break or end up on the floor and then last but not least....dessert. A pan custard, smooth and velvety yumminess that can be whipped up lickety split. Since we are talking about eggs I will probably talk a little bit about potatoes. 

There will be lots of demonstrations in this class but students will still have a chance to practice. Snacks and tools will be provide. Class includes snacks, supplies, tools, recipes and a handout with tips covered in class. 


Supplies will include delicious ingredients, and quality farm fresh eggs. I will purchase chicken, duck and quail eggs to experiment with and discuss when I choose one type of egg over another. To hold your spot, payment is due when you RSVP. If you do not pay for your spot, you will be moved to the waiting list or no list until payment is received.

You can forward payment by using either 

Venmo: user ID Marianne Marrone

Google Wallet: user ID [masked]

One class/ one student: $80

Two classes/two students: $150

Three classes/three students: $210

I love cooking, eating and serving eggs. It is a basic food that is often not illuminated as it should be on a menu. I believe that the way a cook prepares an egg reveals so much about their attention to detail. Eggs are serious business.

***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive input and feedback.  We usually do the reporting and input/feedback in small groups of 3-4 people.  If you can't stay as late as 4:00, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one!  (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability/support session before.) Also, feel free to bring any writings or objects you want to share as part of your anti-racism thinking and work.

We generally schedule one accountability/support session each month. If you are unable to attend and want to be part of accountability, we will consider scheduling an additional session for the month, or choosing a time that works for you in the next month.


For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions."  Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role.  The requirement still applies: you must have attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.


This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy. 

Accessibility Information: Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The fourth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.

Note: We welcome intrepid winter bike riders, though there are not many good spots for parking bikes, and bicycles are prohibited in the building.  We apologize for the inconvenience.

results.description:
There is a new interesting curated exhibit  (Beautiful Decay) with art by living artists at the Danforth Museum.  See more here.  Please join in if this is of interest to you.


Details from the website:

More than a bowl of fruit or a vase of flowers, a still life conveys ideas that go beyond the arrangement of objects and the temporal moment that is captured. Still life compositions represent our thoughts on mortality, the passage of time, our organic nature, or connections to ourselves, family, and the world around us. A still life is actually rather “unstill” in that its subject is often constantly changing.

Still life is deeply rooted in art historical tradition, and has always been heavily symbolic, with meanings attached to the fruits, vegetables, flowers, and other objects of desire meticulously arranged and carefully rendered. Contemporary interpretations look to the art of the Baroque—Italian, Spanish, and Dutch works marked by voluminous and detailed compositions with dramatic lighting and a rich palette. The trompe l’oeil aspect of a still life, seen often in nineteenth-century American art, was particularly captivating to viewers, fooling the eye into believing that there was a third dimension to an otherwise traditional two-dimensional composition. Realism that looks good enough to touch is well represented in the Museum’s permanent collection, in works by Audrey Flack, Phyllis Berman, Denise Mickilowski, and Scott Prior. The “unstill life”—seen in works by Hyman Bloom, Karl Zerbe, Aaron Fink, and Nina Bohlen—engages expressive forms nearing abstraction, and serve as a fitting counterpoint to photo-realism.

Beautiful Decay includes two galleries of works from the Museum’s permanent collection, accompanied by installations from three contemporary artists, Sarah Meyers Brent, Steven Duede, and David Weinberg. Through paintings, drawings, photographs, and mixed media installation, the exhibition invites viewers to expand their definition to explore both the traditional and untraditional still life.

results.description:
Let's meet for our South Shore Beginner-Friendly Bike Ride Kick-Off on a Saturday afternoon at Southfield in Weymouth!  This is one of our favorite biking locations on the South Shore primarily due to the relatively flat and gently sloped terrain with very little vehicle traffic.  We will be meeting and biking around the roads, pathways, and old runways on mostly paved paths with some cracks and some greenery.  Let's meetup and get to know each other while biking around the old Weymouth Naval Air Station!
  We will bike 5-8 miles in about 45 minutes. We will stop along the way every couple of miles or so.  I do keep track of our mileage, time, etc. via an app on my phone.  (If you have an app to track as well please do so.)  Please bring your own bike.

Please be advised we are not professional bikers and this is a leisurely let's-get-back-into-biking ride.  I personally am training for a 25 mile bike ride in June and the early spring rides are more leisurely and shorter than the bike rides in May and June.  I will be happy to host and post some of my other training rides, especially if anyone is interested in participating in the 15 or 25 mile bike rides in June.  If I am able to do so I will bring a pump for your tires. It is my recommendation that you go for a 4-5 mile or 1/2 hr bike ride prior to attending this event.  If you belong to a gym I recommend biking for time &/or mileage a couple of times over the winter before biking outside.  Additionally, I will most likely have a friend join us for the bike ride regardless of whether or not guests are welcome.


  Some notes to keep in mind:

1. If you RSVP Yes please honor your commitment and attend.  If you are unable to attend for any reason please change your RSVP.  If it's too late to do so please post a note on the event wall or send one of the event hosts a message through meetup.  It's the nice thing to do.

2. Pace: As noted above, we will be biking 5-8 miles in the course of 45-60 minutes so we will bike an average speed of 6-10mph today.


3. Please wear a helmet and review the rules of road.  Event Host/Organizer(s) are not responsible for any injuries or liabilities caused by participants.

4. This is weather-dependent. If the ground is too wet we will not bike.  I will post an update in the Conversations a few days prior to the event with a status update. 


5. As an aside, this Spring (March/April/May/maybe early June) my intent is to host Beginner-Friendly Bike Ride as follows: 1-2 in March, 2 April, and 1 in May (3-6 total).  More advanced Bike Rides for Advanced Beginner and Intermediate will be done in April, May, and June.  May and June Bike Rides will be focused on training for the Habitat Bike Ride in June.  After the Habitat Bike Ride and various activities and events in June I hope to resume hosting 1 monthly bike ride starting in July, mostly AB and Intermediate but will add a BF Bike Ride in late summer/early Fall.  *We are  always looking to add people to co/host BF and AB (or even Intermediate) Bike Rides, so please let me know so we can get you some co/hosting experience this Spring.*

***If you want to get back into biking this year then these Beginner-Friendly Bike Rides are the way to go!!  They will be limited in 2016 unless someone else wants to co-host as most of my bike rides will be for Advanced Beginners and Intermediates this year.  So, don't miss out on this event!!!***


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Biking Levels (Rough Guide):

~Beginner-Friendly: Approximately 5-8 miles of relatively flat terrain biking an average speed of 5-10mph in about 45 minutes time.  All levels welcome.

~Advanced Beginner: Either approximately 8-15 miles of mostly flat terrains with some small hills OR approximately 4-6 miles of mostly hills.  (Great for training and getting the heart rate up.)  The flatter longer terrain will have average speeds of 6-12mph biking in about 45 minutes to an hour.  The hillier shorter terrain will have varying average speeds probably closer to 3-4mph uphill and 15+mph (yikes!) downhill averaging 4-12mph.  Both will take about 45 minutes to 1 hr and 15 minutes.  All levels upward welcome.  (Beginner-Friendly bikers may be able to join us on some of these rides. Please check w/ the Event Host(s)/Organizer(s) before signing up to join this type of event.)

~Intermediate: Ride length of 12-25 miles with varying degrees of flat and hilly terrains.  We'll be biking about 8-15mph in about 1-1.5hours.

~Advanced: You can bike 20+ miles in about 1& 1/2-2 hours at an average speed of 12-20mph.

~Expert: You can do it all!!  This is a rare group of talented individuals.

***As always, safety first!  Please wear a helmet and review the rules of road.  Event Host/Organizer(s) are not responsible for any injuries or liabilities caused by participants.  Bike Rides are weather-dependent. If the ground is too wet we will not bike.  I will post an update in the Conversations a few days prior to the event with a status update.***

>>>This can also be found pinned on the Discussions tab.  Here is the direct link.  http://www.meetup.com/SocialFun/messages/boards/thread/48762263
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

South Shore Beginner-Friendly Bike Ride in March

Saturday, March 12th @ 2:30pm
Southfield Parking Lot Next to Old Runway Across from 200 Trotter Road

200 Trotter Road, Weymouth, MA

No Phone #.
Meeting Location: Meet in the parking lot next to the Old Runway across from 200 Trotter Road.  Look for Angela's bike and Silver Toyota RAV4.

Event Organizer/Host(s): Angela & Kirk ~~ We welcome another co-host!  This is a great event to co-host as most of the preliminary work (mostly scheduling) has already been done. ~~

Min/Max: At least 6 Yes RSVPs 48 hours prior to the event (excluding Host and any of Host's Guests). Attendance is limited to 20 total people between SF & SSHBSC.   (The WL is set to Automatic, meaning as a spot opens up the next person on the WL will automatically be moved to the Yes list.  Please be sure to change your RSVP if you are no longer able to attend.)

Guests: 1 adult per member is welcome.

Late Arrivals: We will wait our traditional 5-10 minutes.  Please note we will be circling back to the meeting location.

Cost/Fees:  There are currently no costs or fees associated with this event.  If you have attended at least 3 events and you want to make your $10 voluntary contribution to Social Fun I will be happy to collect and mail it to Biagio.

The Event Organizer(s)/Host(s) reserves the right to cancel this event if we have less than 8 Yes RSVPs combined at the RSVP Deadline.

results.description:
Let's meet for our South Shore Beginner-Friendly Bike Ride Kick-Off on a Saturday afternoon at Southfield in Weymouth!  This is one of our favorite biking locations on the South Shore primarily due to the relatively flat and gently sloped terrain with very little vehicle traffic.  We will be meeting and biking around the roads, pathways, and old runways on mostly paved paths with some cracks and some greenery. Let's meetup and get to know each other while biking around the old Weymouth Naval Air Station!
  We will bike 5-8 miles in about 45 minutes. We will stop along the way every couple of miles or so. I do keep track of our mileage, time, etc. via an app on my phone.  (If you have an app to track as well please do so.)  Please bring your own bike.

Please be advised we are not professional bikers and this is a leisurely let's-get-back-into-biking ride.  I personally am training for a 25 mile bike ride in June and the early spring rides are more leisurely and shorter than the bike rides in May and June.  I will be happy to host and post some of my other training rides, especially if anyone is interested in participating in the 15 or 25 mile bike rides in June.  If I am able to do so I will bring a pump for your tires. It is my recommendation that you go for a 4-5 mile or 1/2 hr bike ride prior to attending this event.  If you belong to a gym I recommend biking for time &/or mileage a couple of times over the winter before biking outside.  Additionally, I will most likely have a friend join us for the bike ride regardless of whether or not guests are welcome.


  Some notes to keep in mind:

1. If you RSVP Yes please honor your commitment and attend.  If you are unable to attend for any reason please change your RSVP.  If it's too late to do so please post a note on the event wall or send one of the event hosts a message through meetup.  It's the nice thing to do.

2. Pace: As noted above, we will be biking 5-8 miles in the course of 45-60 minutes so we will bike an average speed of 6-10mph today.

3. Please wear a helmet and review the rules of road.  Event Host/Organizer(s) are not responsible for any injuries or liabilities caused by participants.

4. This is weather-dependent. If the ground is too wet we will not bike.  I will post an update in the Conversations a few days prior to the event with a status update. 

5. As an aside, this Spring (March/April/May/maybe early June) my intent is to host Beginner-Friendly Bike Ride as follows: 1-2 in March, 2 April, and 1 in May (3-6 total).  More advanced Bike Rides for Advanced Beginner and Intermediate will be done in April, May, and June.  May and June Bike Rides will be focused on training for the Habitat Bike Ride in June.  After the Habitat Bike Ride and various activities and events in June I hope to resume hosting 1 monthly bike ride starting in July, mostly AB and Intermediate but will add a BF Bike Ride in late summer/early Fall.  *We are  always looking to add people to co/host BF and AB (or even Intermediate) Bike Rides, so please let me know so we can get you some co/hosting experience this Spring.*

***If you want to get back into biking this year then these Beginner-Friendly Bike Rides are the way to go!!  They will be limited in 2016 unless someone else wants to co-host as most of my bike rides will be for Advanced Beginners and Intermediates this year.  So, don't miss out on this event!!!***

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Biking Levels (Rough Guide):

~Beginner-Friendly: Approximately 5-8 miles of relatively flat terrain biking an average speed of 5-10mph in about 45 minutes time.  All levels welcome.

~Advanced Beginner: Either approximately 8-15 miles of mostly flat terrains with some small hills OR approximately 4-6 miles of mostly hills.  (Great for training and getting the heart rate up.)  The flatter longer terrain will have average speeds of 6-12mph biking in about 45 minutes to an hour.  The hillier shorter terrain will have varying average speeds probably closer to 3-4mph uphill and 15+mph (yikes!) downhill averaging 4-12mph.  Both will take about 45 minutes to 1 hr and 15 minutes.  All levels upward welcome.  (Beginner-Friendly bikers may be able to join us on some of these rides. Please check w/ the Event Host(s)/Organizer(s) before signing up to join this type of event.)

~Intermediate: Ride length of 12-25 miles with varying degrees of flat and hilly terrains.  We'll be biking about 8-15mph in about 1-1.5hours.

~Advanced: You can bike 20+ miles in about 1& 1/2-2 hours at an average speed of 12-20mph.

~Expert: You can do it all!!  This is a rare group of talented individuals.

***As always, safety first!  Please wear a helmet and review the rules of road.  Event Host/Organizer(s) are not responsible for any injuries or liabilities caused by participants. Bike Rides are weather-dependent. If the ground is too wet we will not bike.  I will post an update in the Conversations a few days prior to the event with a status update.***

>>>This can also be found pinned on the Discussions tab.  Here is the direct link. http://www.meetup.com/SocialFun/messages/boards/thread/48762263

results.description:
Beauty can be seen in all things, seeing and composing the beauty is what separates the snapshot from the photograph. – Matt Hardy

The weather looks fantastic for Saturday. Join us as we explore the charming, historic, area of Boston known as Beacon Hill. We will focus on photographing the architectural details of this area packed with Federal, Greek Revival, and Victorian architectural treasures, antique shops and historic landmarks. This makes great practice for any traveling you may do where you want to capture the spirit of a place. What makes it unique? 

Three skills you will practice to help you take better pictures:

• See: What is your creative vision. Using composition and visual elements of color, texture and line to express the essence of what you see.

• Do: Do the right thing. Understand the fundamental camera settings necessary to realize your vision and make sure your photos are in clear focus and properly exposed. This will be a good time to practice going off the Auto setting  with my guidance. 

• Be: Be present and connected to your surroundings so you can create photos from your personal experience. This makes the difference between a snapshot and a photograph. 

Come discover the architectural details of Beacon Hill in Boston hidden in plain sight. You can make the ordinary extraordinary through your photography.


We will visit the most exclusive neighborhood on the hill, Louisburg Square, and the African Meeting House, an important underground railroad destination for runaway slaves.


Learning to see creatively means slowing down to notice simple details right in front of you that have the potential to make a great photo. The things other people walk right by will suddenly jump out at you begging for your attention.

First, we will meet in front of Peets Cafe and I will introduce you to some simple step by step practices for creative seeing so you can find beauty in the most unexpected places.

I have designed a series of  30 minute practices we will do together that will improve your composition, depth of field, and basic camera settings. Then you will have some time on your own to wander.


You will have a chance to try these out right away with my guidance.  You will receive individual coaching and critique while we are on the streets shooting. This way you can be confident that you will be able to repeat the process next time you are out on a shoot. This is a great session if you are interested in travel photography.

We will work with color, texture, pattern, and light to make our photos come to life. As always, this is a non technical jargon zone. It is all about the creative act of seeing and capturing the moments of life with a fresh eye.


I have found a fantastic area on Beacon Hill for our shoot. The winding streets are packed with interesting colors, reflections, architectural details, pipes, door knockers, all kinds of things you would never imagine would make great photo. 

Photo By former class participant Monica. T station base of Beacon Hill Old meets New. Good strong composition where the three blocks of color come together to create a unified feeling.

I will share some simple tips for editing your photos to make them even more stunning.


This workshop is for you if:

• You own a camera and you'd really like to use it more, but you're not really sure where to start and what to do to use it more creatively. 

• Maybe you've taken a photography workshop before or tried picking up one of those thick, boring books, but you quickly got overwhelmed and overloaded with the technical stuff.

• Your photos are “nice” but not jaw dropping all that often. You are not sure what to do to make them more dramatic and stunning. Time to go off auto.

Photo by class participant Lisa using reflections to capture fresh perspective

Any camera is fine for this shoot. You can even use your iPhone if you like. This is a fun, fast paced workshop. So if you would like to meet other people who love photography and are curious about how to take better photos, I hope you will join us.

The $45.00 tuition for the workshop.

We are going to have a great time! You have joined the group, now join the fun. RSVP right away to hold your space. I look forward to seeing you this Saturday from 2:30-5:30

Suzanne

P.S. After class we will stop in a pub on Charles Street for refreshments and look at our photos from the day. Plan to join for this social part of the fun

More details will be provided once we have the full class participant list.

results.name: Learn to use your camera exploring Beacon Hill:  Fun Photo Workshop

results.description:
EMBRACE OF THE SERPENT ADVANCED TICKETS

Filmed on location in magnificent, breathtaking widescreen black-and-white cinematography, the heart of the Amazonian jungle is the setting for this blistering and poetic tale of the ravages of colonialism on nature and native people. Karamakate, a mystic Amazonian shaman and the last survivor of his people, serves as guide to an ailing German ethnographic explorer in 1909, and again thirty years later to an American who follows, both searching for the sacred healing plant, the Yakruna. Filled with regret and loneliness over the loss of his people and unable to fully trust the white men he agrees to guide, Karamakate ultimately proves an invaluable resource to the explorers, both of whom are curious to learn about his lost culture. Inspired by actual journals kept by two Amazonian explorers,Embrace of the Serpent is co-written and directed by Ciro Guerra. 

Academy Award nominee for Best Foreign Language Film.

98% on Rotten Tomatoes.  

"Creating this kind of otherworldly mood takes exceptional talent, and this is a film worth experiencing." - Walter V. AddiegoSan Francisco Chronicle 

See you on the Amazon

John

results.name: EMBRACE OF THE SERPENT

Be there or be squaya!

This is a MIX & MINGLE, sweethearts! we want to keep shifting chairs so you can meet who you want & avoid those who you don't want. 
  
And don't whine about walking, that is part of the Mixing! Getting trapped behind tables? Won't happen, no thanks, my lovelies!  (*"my lovelies" is common in the Aussie language and pertains to either gender).    
  
Central Square is also known as "Mental Square;"  (also"Penguin Square," "zombie square," and "beggar square" and some other pejoratives I'd best not mention).


4:45= Asgard  Irish Pub. 
    
5:30= Phoenix Landing. Cool vibes, not too loud. Unless there's a soccer game...  they also have a sidewalk patio.   
   
6:15= thirty minutes only. Out of the Blue Gallery & Graffiti alley.  That's 541 Mass Ave they do not serve booze at this hour of the day. Graffiti alley doesn't serve booze either. It's an alley. 
  6:45= Brick and Mortar bar, 567 Mass Ave upstairs
http://www.brickmortarltd.com/

7:30= The Field PATIO, bring a jacket in case it's chilly. Otherwise be prepared to jump up and down like an Aborigine to keep warm. 

8:15= Tavern in the Square.

9:00= People's Republik   ...they have a 500 lb bomb casing (I guess it isn't live but who can tell.. I ain't gonna touch it with my left pinky) in there from WW2. And notice the pastel it shows the founder of this place as Jesus Christ at the Last Supper. The founder still lives in JP.
  
Hop in, hop out. Host will stick to schedule.  You don't need to. 

Some of these pubs are CASH ONLY!
  
Photo above-- actual from one of my Social Fun pub hops in Central Square!!

results.description:
EVENT IS FULL

Its time for a return engagement of our Screw top & Sneaker event from last year--it was so popular, we had to do it twice!   


This is a FREE event focused on your favorite screw top wines, simple foods to go with and the ultimate casual foot gear--sneakers! 

Join your fellow wine lovers for a fun evening discussing the virtues of screw cap vs corks, white vs red, Louboutin vs NB. Maybe make some new friends, discover a new favorite wine, or some new footwear--maybe all the above!

I still love the ceremony of pulling a cork out of a bottle, but most wine in the US is consumed within an hour of its purchase, so its hard to argue with the practicality of screw tops. This kind of BYOB event is a great way to get exposed to a wide selection of what is on the market today. Plus our members always bring great food too!

Check out last year's event here: http://www.meetup.com/Bostonwine/events/219307152/


This event is FREE! 

but please bring either wine or food, but you won't be turned away if you bring both :-)

==> READ THIS! The event starts promptly at 5:00 PM, so please be on time.  Greeters will be on hand from 5:00 - 6:00 PM. Security is tight and access shuts down at 6:00 PM. You won't be able to get in if late!  <==

POLICIES

NOTE: As part of the RSVP process you will be asked to accept the group's Policies and Disclaimer (use a new web browser window to see the "About Us" section of our group's home page). Then click on RSVP for this event and answer "Yes" to the policy question--You must accept policies as part of your RSVP for each event that you attend. (Note, apparently some versions of the Meetup mobile app don't display this question -- in that case, RSVP with your phone and then use a web browser later on to update your RSVP). 

WINE

Please bring a bottle of your favorite screw-top wine, red, white, rose, sweet--your choice. In most cases this will be an inexpensive, simple but satisfying every day wine, but there is no price limit and the wine can be sourced from any country. We will vote on best wine by color independent of price -- winners will receive a funny prize!

FOOD

We also need simple foods to accompany because we are a hungry crowd. Suggestions: finger foods, olives, nuts, breads, sandwiches, terrines, pate, veggies and dip, pizza, chips... really, anything goes. 

DRESS

Casual, relaxed, wear a pair of your favorite sneakers. 

WHERE

The event will be held in the Club Room of the Hanover CambridgePark apartment building near the Alewife T station. 

We have access to a demonstration kitchen, fridge, ice machine, etc. 

Hanover CambridgePark 
160 CambridgePark Drive 
Club Room, 1st floor 
Cambridge, MA 02140 

Phone:[masked]

T stop: Alewife (Red line)

Parking: Unfortunately, there is no guest parking at Hanover. Public transportation or a car service such as Uber is preferable. Otherwise, park at Alewife T station ($7). Park and walk to main lobby of 160 and follow general directions. 

ABOUT

The Hanover CambridgePark is a luxury apartment building complex in the Alewife area of Cambridge. It has a spacious club room where we'll be meeting, a spa-like pool, fitness center, pool, courtyard with fire pits, grills, high-end finishes, etc. 

For those interested in seeing a model apartment, leasing staff will be on hand before the event to do a tour (call ahead to be sure to get a spot). Remember to let them know that you're part of BostonWine. ;-) 

Looking forward to seeing you all!

-Jim
results.name: Screw caps and Sneakers 2016!!!

results.description:
This is a lecture by Lance Keimig about the history of light painting, which goes along well with our other two events about Introduction to light painting and Making your own light paint tools.


Angelo On The Roof, 1979, David Lebe

The History of Light Painting is not easy to trace as it was not clearly defined as a medium until very recently. However, photographers, artists, and scientists have been experimenting with light painting and light drawing in various ways since the late19th century. In this lecture Lance will connect the dots between the earliest uses of artificial light in photography and the modern light art that has captivated so many people today.

Today the possibilities for light painting and light drawing are only as limited as the imagination. The tools and technology available today are specialized and sophisticated, and Lance will show some of his own work and a number of contemporary light painting images by other artists and describe how they were made.

Synergy album cover for "Games", Eric Staller, 1978

The first chapter of  the new edition of Lance’s book, Night Photography and Light Painting: Finding Your Way in the Dark summarizes the History of Light Painting, and signed copies will be available.

Vertigo, 2013, Dennis Calvert
results.name: Lecture: History of Light Painting and deconstructing some contemporary work

results.description:
http://www.uniteboston.com/event/peer-servants-concert-for-economic-empowerment/ 

Come celebrate and learn about getting involved in a great global adventure.  When we see global need, most of us wonder how to respond. The desire of the materially poor of our world is not for a handout, but just like you and me, they want to work to meet their needs. Often they only need someone to believe in them.

PEER Servants partners with indigenous Christian micro-finance organizations that are believing in people all around the world and providing opportunities for them, through micro-finance, to live with dignity. Through the provision of small loans, business training and spiritual encouragement our brothers and sisters are establishing small businesses and experiencing the joy of overcoming poverty, taking care of their families and blessing their communities.

Programs are: 

-Worship with musicians from around the world. 


-Hear stories of our global family extending the kingdom of heaven.
-Discover practical ways to use your gifts and skills to get involved.
-Enjoy an international dessert buffet. 

** This is a free event.
results.name: PEER Servants Concert for Economic Empowerment

results.description:
Scenergy Dating is bringing a bit of mystery, anticipation, and excitement into your dating life with our signature "Mystery Cards" icebreaker. You may have heard of Speed Dating events but Scenergy Dating is unlike anything you've experienced. For starters, we emphasize a "dress to impress" atmosphere where professional singles of all backgrounds are welcome to mix and mingle under one roof. Our professional staff understands the jitters that come with attending a singles event and they do a great job at calming your nerves and welcoming you in.

Once you enter, instead of spending time texting friends, you will be encouraged to make new connections while also enjoying our signature icebreaker in a trendy environment hand selected by your coordinator.


WHAT MAKES SCENERGY DIFFERENT:

- We're a full dating solution that also provides personal matchmaking, online dating, and a variety of events.
- Our events are "Shaken not Stirred"!
- Event Coordinators not only check you in but are actively engaged in ensuring you have a good time and feel safe.
- We host seminars, dance lessons, dating workshops, and many types of icebreakers to keep you entertained.


HOW "MYSTERY SINGLES" WORKS:

- Singles will receive an index card
- They will fill out information according to the coordinator's instructions
- Coordinator will then pass around the cards
- Attendees will be encouraged to find their "Mystery Single", while also mixing & mingling
- The more you play the more chances you have in winning grand prizes!


WHAT TO DO/NOT TO DO:

- DO get your money's worth and approach as many singles as you can!
- DO bring your friends but DO NOT stay in your comfort zone!
- DO focus on socializing and making new friends DO NOT just focus on looks!

ENTRANCE FEE:


* Limited to the first 20 men and 20 women so it's important to pre-pay. In order to have a close number of men and women we will sell tickets in increments of 10, when both genders are sold out we will release more tickets accordingly.
- $25 at the door
- $15 pre-paid by RSVP by CLICKING HERE
- $15 at the door "Tag Along Special" (Bring a friend and both save $5)

PERKS:

- Huge drink specials for Scenergy attendees only.


RAFFLE PRIZES:

- FREE passes to future Scenergy Dating events, cash prizes, and so much more!
results.name: Scenergy Dating Presents "Spring Mystery Singles" (Mid 30's - 50's)

Winchester Drum Circle is held on the 2nd Saturday of each month at Yoga Mandala, 750 Main St. 2nd floor, Winchester, MA from 7:00 to 9:00 pm. The parking and the entrance is on the right side of the building. Shoes will have to be removed before entering the studio. $5/per person.

Please join us for this open and welcoming circle.

results.description:
Walking into your local wine shop you may not see a sign for Wines from Portugal.  They may have only fortified wines, and a random bottle of Vinho Verde. But it's worth putting in a request or tracking down a store with more Portuguese options: these are wines that should be appearing at your dinner table. If you have a favorite go-to wine, whether it's Malbec, Barbera, or Chardonnay, chances are that Portugal has a fresh alternative that might cost even less.

Port and Vinho Verde may be familiar to you, but have you ever heard of Castelão or Fernão Pires? These are just two of the many grapes that are native to Portugal, and not grown much anywhere else. Let's get together and taste some of Portugal's grapes and growing regions  - you may just find a new favorite!

Please bring a bottle of Portuguese wine in a paper wine bag, 4 wine glasses and $10 to contribute toward food that will be provided


***This is a home with cats and dogs, so if you have allergies please be prepared ****
results.name: Portuguese Wines

results.description:
Our monthly dance this month is "Celebration in Green"; a head-start on St. Paddy's Day and the coming of Spring. We'll start with a Rumba lesson at 7:30 pm and then from 8 pm on we'll have a mix of waltz, cha-cha, foxtrot, swing, hustle, quick step and, yes, rumba, for your dancing pleasure. There will be mixers and dance hosts.
We won't be scheduling a "ballroom basics" lesson this month, but if you'd like to try out ballroom dancing, or just haven't been in a while, don't be shy, come on out.
Dress is casual, but if you wear something green you'll likely have lots of company!
Last month we had a sell-out crowd. If you plan on attending, by all means RSVP here, but also call Tom @[masked] to reserve your place. Cost is $12.00 per person.

results.description:
During this special event for singles and couples, you will be empowered with distinctions and skills to greatly enhance your sensual connections. Allow yourself to be deeply nourished as you are guided through 10 non-sexual tantric connection exercises in the context of a Sacred Ritual. Learn an 8 step protocol for creating your own sacred sensual rituals at home.


Within a safe and sacred space you will be guided to:

• Create sacred space

• Set intentions and honor boundaries

• Cultivate exquisite presence for soulful connection

• Connect with yourself, your body, sensations, breath and energy


• Honor each others' innocent divine human essence

• Practice Tantric harmonizing techniques, utilizing awareness, breath, sound and energy

• Give and receive conscious, nurturing touch

• Stay true to yourself by expressing your desires, preferences and boundaries

• Discover how an attitude of curiosity can open the door to whole new realms of possibility

This non-sexual, clothing-on event is open to all, regardless of experience level, relationship status, gender identity or sexual orientation. Beginners welcome! You may attend alone or with a partner or a friend.


Limited Space. We expect this multi-MeetUp event to sell out, so be sure to secure your spot via Eventbrite! RSVPs on MeetUp do not reflect accurate registration numbers, nor do they secure your spot.

PLEASE NOTE: We are SOLD OUT for SINGLE MEN. Only those who have PURCHASED THEIR TICKET will be admitted. (Sign up early for my next event: http://bit.ly/21Y2XDA)

There are still a few spots for single women and couples.

Fee: $40 through eventbrite; $50 at the door (women and couples only)

WOMEN & COUPLES SECURE YOUR SPOT HERE: http://bit.ly/1QK0jpP

(No need to print your ticket, if you paid, you will be on the guest list.)

Brynn Bishop is an Advanced Certified Tantra Educator and Intimacy Coach with over twenty-five years experience in the field of Conscious Relating. Her mission is to empower people to create authentic, loving, pleasurable relationships with themselves and others. She specializes in catalyzing individuals to reclaim their voice, release sexual shame, and awaken their sacred erotic potential. Brynn’s unique approach weaves together cutting edge Somatic Psychology and Trauma Resolution with Taoist and Tantric Healing Arts and Awakening practices - providing the most effective methods of healing, transformation and empowerment. She teaches nationally and maintains a private practice in Boston and via phone and Skype. www.conscious-intimacy.com

What past participants are saying:

“Great enlightenment and synergy. Safe and nourishing...warm and comforting. Brynn, you are a wonder and I send gratitude to you and all attendees.”

“Brynn is a master in creating a powerful and deep experience - for the new and experienced alike. I truly enjoyed this event and took a lot home to practice and think about. Thanks again for the wonderful experience, Brynn!”

“The workshop was such a wonderful afternoon of tranquility and connection. Brynn's presence and approach created a warm and giving environment.” - Charlie

“Brynn is amazing in creating a trusting space for people with all different experience. I had a memorable, tender experience and I appreciate everyone’s presence and energy which made it possible. thank you.”- Asma

“Brynn always does a great job in creating sacred space. I love her exercises; they build a lot of good, positive energy. This program really gave me some insight into being deeply sourced, being more present, and into creating a better ritual for honoring my partner.”

“Thank you for such a wonderful workshop. My soul was deeply nourished. It truly met my needs in a deep way, and I met some wonderful like-minded people.” - Laurie

“Intensely pleasurable and heart opening."
results.name: SOLD OUT Tantric Ritual for Enhanced Connection

results.description:
Wait Until Dark

by Frederick Knott
Directed by Phil Markella

A con man and two ex-convicts are about to meet their match. They have traced the location of a mysterious doll to the Greenwich Village apartment of Sam Hendrix and his blind wife, Susy. Sam had apparently been persuaded by a strange woman to transport the doll across the Canadian border, not knowing that sewn inside were several grams of heroin. When the woman is murdered, the situation becomes more urgent. The sinister men try to trick Susy into handing over the doll, but she refuses to reveal its location, and when she figures out she is the victim of a bizarre charade, a deadly game of cat and mouse begins. So when darkness falls, she turns off all the lights, leaving everyone to maneuver in the dark until the game ends.

Ticket Prices

$ 20.00 General Admission
$ 18.00 Seniors & Students
Tickets on Line:

http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2464968 http://www.plymouthcommunitytheatre.net Get your tickets online before RSVP'ing.

The Second Saturday Of Every Month
Saturday March 12th, 8pm, $8
The Riot Theater, 146a South Street, Jamaica Plain, MA

Be aware our last two shows SOLD OUT.

http://www.theriottheater.com/laughing-liberally-boston.html
With the 2016 Presidential primaries kicking into high gear, with Donald Trump and Ted Cruz saying crazy things on a nearly daily basis, we need progressive laughs now more than ever. That's why we have Laughing Liberally Boston, a monthly progressive political comedy show featuring some Boston’s top liberal and progressive comedians.

Laughing Liberally Boston is hosted by comedian, satirist and progressive talk radio host Matthew Filipowicz. For more information about Matthew, visit http://matthewf.net.

Comedians on the March 12th bill include: Kenice Mobley, Ted Pettingell, Tawanda Gona, Phoebe Angle, and Nick Ortolani.

In addition to some of the finest progressive comedians Boston has to offer, each Laughing Liberally Boston show will feature a special interview segment with a local political figure, journalist or activist. This month’s guest is Susan E. Eaton. Susan is a professor at Brandies University and the author of the new book, Integration Nation: Immigrants, Refugees, And America At Its Best.

Laughing Liberally Boston takes place the second Saturday of every month, with the next show on Saturday March 12th at 8pm at the Riot Theater, 146a South Street, Jamaica Plain, MA. Admission is $8. Purchase advance tickets here.
http://www.theriottheater.com/laughing-liberally-boston.html
results.name: Laughing Liberally Boston

results.description:
Let's dance salsa!

Saturday Night Salsa is Boston's biggest salsa dance party on Saturday featuring salsa dancing and lessons with Salsa y Control, an amazing venue filled with 300+ welcoming salsa dancers, an inexpensive parking garage next door, and public transport on Mass Ave. (Red Line, Buses 1, 64 etc.) one block away!

9:00-10:00 pm:  Beginner & Intermediate. Salsa Lessons
10:00-2 am: Dance Party * No Partner Required

Lets meet at 9 pm (facing the stage) at the right side of the stage.

There are some tables alongside the wall. These tables are typically first come, first serve, so if we all arrive at the same time and early, we can occupy these tables.

I will make some Meetup signs and try to post them at these tables.  These tables can serve as our meeting point through out the night.  Last time I asked for permission and  management informed me that posting signs was not allowed.  I may not ask for permission this time and discretely post a night flat on the table.  

I also have some neon/glow-in-the-dark bracelets and necklaces that I plan to wear and pass out to members of the group so we can recognize each other more easily.

Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  This is an actual event, not an advertisement. 

Please be on time! If you arrive late, I can not guarantee that you will be able to recognize members of the group from the crowds.

This should be a super fun event and a super friendly event for salsa beginners and the advanced dancers.


I am really looking forward to enjoying this event as part of the group.

Wear comfortable shoes!

Joana

******************************************************************************************************************************

Event Details

Beginners Very Welcome

No partner required

$12 - Admission includes lesson and party

Dress Code: Smart Casual to Elegant (No ball caps, no work boots, etc.)

Beer, Wine, Mixed Drinks, etc. available at Bar

Music format: 65% salsa, 25% bachata, 10% merengue/cha cha

***********************************
Driving Directions: Take Storrow or Memorial Drive to River St. (where the two gas stations are), then a right on Mass Ave, a right on Pearl St (where FootLocker and Putnam Furniture is), and your first right on Green St.

Parking: There is a large, inexpensive ($1.50/hr)parking garage right next door - you can't miss it!

Walking Directions (from Red Line's Central Stop): From Mass Ave take a left on Prospect St then a left on Green St. It is a one minute walk.

Please note that the Night Salsa parties are 21+.

* Don't forget your ID!

http://www.havanaclubsalsa.com
results.how_to_find_us: Right side of the stage at 8:45pm sharp!
results.name: Lets Dance Salsa!  at the Havana Club in Central Square! Lesson Included!

results.description:
Come rage against the night before Daylight Savings begins with Boston A-List's Best Night of Comedy, THE MENDOZA LINE!

This and every Saturday night live from the back room of the The Dugout Cafe (722 Comm Ave), John Baglio, Julia Claire, and Zach "Zack" Armentrout bring you a different lineup stacked with the biggest, baddest, and bestiest comedians from Boston and beyond. And guess what? Its only FIVE DOLLARS! With drink specials as far as the eye can see and free popcorn, this intimate atmosphere is the perfect place to take in some meaningful and quality laughs!

Here's the link to buy your tickets now to guarantee a seat as room is limited. Our shows have frequently sold out, and we'd hate to break your little heart and turn you away: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-mendoza-line-bostons-best-weekly-comedy-showcase-tickets-15228587114

This week's INCREDIBLE show features the comedic talents of:

Andrew Durso (Anderson Comedy)

Jaime Loftus (Comedy Central, Playboy)

Jere Pilapil (LOLstel, Worcester comic)

Steve Macone (The New Yorker, The Onion)

Kate Ghiloni (Seattle International Comedy Festival)

AND MORE! COME THROUGH WE LOVE YOU ALWAYS & FOREVER!
